item.title: Building an Autonomous Robot to navigate through a model town (Ongoing)
item.description: January 2022 - Present Working on an intensive course project for the class ME597 - Autonomous Systems, which involves, building a 4-wheeled autonomous robot (as shown in the picture above), consisting of Ultrasonic Sensors, a Camera, and a Line Tracking Sensor Processing and handling of all sensor data will be done using a Raspberry Pi on the robot, running Ubuntu 20.04, using ROS and Python Current work done includes performing a preliminary simulation in Gazebo using the LIDAR sensor data to perform a simple robot motion Upcoming work involves implementing Path Planning, Trajectory Optimization, SLAM and Perception capabilities into the robot to then eventually perform the task of navigating through a model town with various environmental obstacles autonomously
